intro: Corethrogyne californica, commonly known as the California corethrogyne, is a rare and endemic plant species found primarily in the coastal regions of California. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae, characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the shoreline, where it is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong coastal winds. Its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements make it a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts to protect its natural environment.
